729218f-a.folder: Newark Avenue & Richmond Terrace, Staten Island, NY
729218f-a.text:
Newark Avenue, at Richmond Terrace. The view is north from a point about 150 feet south of the Terrace,toward Kill Van Kull. The Bayonne Bridge was later erected across the Kill west of the
frame houses seen on the left.
March 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr
729218f-a.title: Richmond: Newark Avenue - Richmond Terrace

729219f-a.folder: Newark Avenue & Richmond Terrace, Staten Island, NY
729219f-a.text:
Newark Avenue, east side, south from Richmond Terrace. On the left are the rears of dwellings facing on John Street.
May 22, 1929
P.L. Sperr
729219f-a.title: Richmond: Newark Avenue - Richmond Terrace

729220f-a.folder: Newark Avenue & Richmond Terrace, Staten Island, NY
729220f-a.text:
Newark Avenue, west side, south from (No. 23) Richmond Terrace. The cleared area, which runs parallel with Newark Avenue, is now (1939) spanned by the Bayonne Bridge.
March 24, 1928
P. L. Sperr
729220f-a.title: Richmond: Newark Avenue - Richmond Terrace

729441f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Newark Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729441f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace, north side, between Newark Avenue and Morningstar Road. The Bayonne Bridge now spans this site.
March 24, 1928
L. Sperr  P.
729441f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Newark Avenue

729442f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Newark Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729442f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace, east from a point between Newark Avenue and John Street, showing the Dean Linseed 0il Works.
May 22, 1929
P. L. Sperr
729442f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Newark Avenue

729505f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Newark Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729505f-a.text:
2453 Richmond Terrace, north side, at the foot of Newark
Avenue. The view is westward.
March 24, 1928
P. L. Sperr
729505f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Newark Avenue
